topic.title: Problem z tor w zeronet wersja windowsowa / Problem with tor in zeronet windows version
topic.body:
Używam ZeroNet w wersji windowsowej na maszynie Windows 10 x64. Włączyłem autorun w aplikacji by uruchamiał ZeroNet wraz z startem Windowsa. Problem, który dostrzegłem to dodatek tor tak jakby nie ładuje się poprawnie ponieważ mam ciągle Tor:oczekiwanie. Dopiero po zabiciu procesu tor.exe i ponownym uruchomieniu zeronet.exe tor jest otwarty. Czy ktoś zna sposób rozwiązania tego błędu ?

I am using ZeroNet in Windows version on Windows 10 x64 (don't have 7 or ubuntu). I just enabled autorun in zeronet app to run it automaticly with windows. Problem is that the tor addon is not loading correctly. There is somethink like tor:waiting all the time on main site. When I kill the process tor.exe and rerun zeronet.exe manually tor is working correctly. Anyone know the resolution to correct this issue ?

Sorry for PL - it suppose to be in polish forum but in some way it comes in english forum.

1516534621_19WW28sn46rz9h15xf6NCELPdzxZ2.body: It is a pity that torghost does not exist on windows platform.

1512623414_1HBy99H2dsCwevdYZp8VVC2SVG69D.body: More likely it is still alive and I hope it will be growing up. Just need to be more popular to be growing.

1516897351_15C1QHgbZtqgBQm8DY9MLkftgND9C.body: The reason to use Polish was that on this  post on bottom of it was text to use Polish language. Something like suggestion in yellow frame. So that was the reason to write it in polish . Sorry for that but I just did what was in recommendation ..... "Use Polish language"

> [mnemonic](#comment_31_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): English mother*ucker, do you speak it?If you can't be bothered, use http://translate.google.com

Sorry but I am not a mother*ucker ..... that was rude and really low intelligent

> [catmanyoda](#comment_1_14fPfJZ6aNTsVoRjGHfprq78VtvBN1vx9F): Next time press "Polski" if you're going to post in that language.

I really did that and the post was here no mater what language I pressed

> [programmingdata](#comment_25_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): So.. You are not newbie like I thought. It was just a mistake.

I think it was some issue in script, don't known why. Never mind , now this one is written in both english and polish language

> [mnemonic](#comment_32_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): Its a meme (did you see the link/movie?), didn't mean to do any harm. Welcome to the site.

Ok  , but I didn't saw that link/movie

> [programmingdata](#comment_26_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): Are you using Firefox?

Yes I am , 57.0.4 x64 , adblock ,kee and VideoDownloadHelper
ZeroNet is in 0.6.1 version

> [programmingdata](#comment_27_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): I  tested Firefox and Waterfox and I got the same problem.I have no problem with TOR brower.Go to  ZeroNet data folder, backup zeronet.conf, open zeronet.conf with notepad and type this:[global]tor = always [...]

Ok , I will try this one . I hope this will resolve that issue

what with this one:
ControlPort 49051
SOCKSPort 49050

they are as default in torrc config
Should I change them or just left as they are ?

OK , I just rebooted system , On my browser in ZeroHello is "Your browser is not safe" (wasn't before) and Tor:waiting :(

about torrc I suppose to left ports as they are ?

> [programmingdata](#comment_31_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): If you mean "I just rebooted Operating system" then There is no need for this.Close ZeroNet application.Start Tor Browser and wait for tor.exe starts.Open ZeroNet application.now access ZeroNet Network with TOR browser.

Ok , but what if I am using this integrated tor.exe in zeronet app . Not the torbrowser bundle.

> [programmingdata](#comment_32_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): I found out your ISP is blocking  your TOR connections. ZeroNet has no Tor pluggable transports. If ZeroNet can not access TOR network, you always see TOR:WaitingThat's why you need this workaround

Ok, so explain me why after killing tor.exe and restarted zeronet.exe tor is not waiting , just working correctly ? I just trying to understand that one to get best resolution for it. (not using torbrowser bundle)

> [programmingdata](#comment_33_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): Pay more Attention. ZeroNet has tor.exe built-in. If you start ZeroNet first, ZeroNet will use tor.exe built-in. Your ISP is blocking TOR connections.So IF you start TOR browser bundle first with obsf4 enabled, ZeroNet will use tor.exe browser bundle.

Ok thanks for all the instructions. I will test them all 
Thanks again !

> [programmingdata](#comment_34_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): I tested Firefox with this workaround. If you made this correctly, then it will works. However you must have TOR browser bundle running.

By default bundle is using Chrome right now , I will try to make it work correctly with waterfox and all Your suggestion without bundle (using tor expert). I hope to get it work :) if not I will ask for more suggestions :)
almost done :D .... just need to get this "Your browser is not safe" to resolve.

> [programmingdata](#comment_38_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): Are you using TBB?

No , Tor expert .... all the things in command prompt

> [programmingdata](#comment_41_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): If you decide to use Firerfox or Waterfox, you can use those tweaks for more security and privacy [...]

That's nice ... I will try with all of them on waterfox.

> [programmingdata](#comment_44_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): Most of those tweaks are default configuration on TBB

I add all of them to waterfox and his tor expert . Everything is going threw TOR . For now it looks like working perfect :D

> [programmingdata](#comment_45_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): Is it  "For now it looks like working perfect :D" means no more "Your browser is not safe" message?

No messages for now , TOR all the time working and connected . Looks great :D

> [programmingdata](#comment_46_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): That's good to hear. For some reason, when I'm using normal Firefox I got "Your browser is not safe" message.When I'm using Firefox portable everything works well.

I used sugesstions from http://127.0.0.1:43110/14gSEpfWfF5Go7u5y7UidZQCnGa6eSBYZ9/?wrapper_nonce=bc04ed698a595c9c5f839452f76c343cf8ad60ee620e4bd6188bace7ba6d5cb9 and from You . Only issue is that No script security is not working on my Waterfox (too old)

I didn't try portable one , just dont't need them (for now) :)

> [programmingdata](#comment_47_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): Copy noscript from TBB extensions folder (torbrowser\Browser\TorBrowser\Data\Browser\profile.default\extensions) to Waterfox extension folder(I cant remember the path).

ooo ,I will try this method ..... about Poland forum on same question it looks like there is no one from Poland except me

> [programmingdata](#comment_49_1EqzMve3ZFTvmF8H2v2iebeLvcZJPnSbig): You can activate legacy extension support on Firefox and Waterfox but I can't remember how. If it not works, You can use Firefox ESR.I saw the suggestions from privacytools.io. They don't recommend Windows 10, just like me. We can get a clean windows 7 x64 image from here :https://tb.rg-adguard.net/index.php?lang=en-US&extract&sid=e754ec15-9352-ebbc-ece8-17b48aacded3

I know windows 10 is a  bit of s**t but I have no other possibility. Only way is Windows 10 way ... :) Of course I have live Kali but I also like to play World of Warcraft on this computer so only way for now is Window 10 .... maybe in the future I will have money for gaming laptop and then I will have multi operating system :D  
About that legacy extension ... good idea , I will look around for this on Waterfox.

1557456427_1DgRMcgsHLQfLfsXGKkFVnSoFtEYP.body:
> [gitcentermobile](#comment_9_1BDzk7UPg7TeTu8gdY5eefwKKRyu4yWpXo): Take a look at Kiwipedia by me.

no trackers till now

1557991095_12kqbnJ3QpaT6extMyBhPzaWvbi8x.body: I think yes , but not easy to be found ... use search engines to discover
just exploring and trying with words like child sex porn etc
Just like in TOR here most of us did not accept child porn as we see in comments
